titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Ralph W. Cummings Papers

controlnote.p: EAD generated by NCSU Libraries' Collection Guides application using data imported from ArchivesSpace.

maintenanceagency.agencyname: North Carolina State University Libraries, Special Collections Research Center

did.abstract: The Ralph W. Cummings Papers document the personal and professional life of Ralph W. Cummings. The primary focus of the collection is Cummings' career as a professor, researcher and administrator working at North Carolina State University and with international organizations in the fields of soil science and agronomy. The collection also contains the personal papers and letters of Ralph Cummings and the Cummings family papers which include a number of land deeds and legal documents dating from 1840 until 2001 as well as the personal papers of extended family members.

Ralph W. Cummings (1911-2001) was born in Reidsville, North Carolina. He was the head of the Department of Agronomy at North Carolina State University from 1942 until 1947. He held a number of administrative positions for the University over the scope of his career, as well as working in research and leadership positions for a number of national and international organizations concerned with world agriculture and agricultural education and research.
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Special Collections Research Center Reference Staff.

corpname.part: North Carolina State University Libraries, Special Collections Research Center

acqinfo.p: Gift of Ralph Cummings Jr. and Eunice Cummings in 2001 (Accn. no. 2001-0015)

arrangement.p: The collection is divided into three main series: Personal Papers, Photographs, and Professional Papers.
The Personal Papers are further divided into three subseries: Cummings Family Papers, Ralph W. Cummings Personal Correspondence, and Ralph W. Cummings Personal Documents.

The Professional Papers are further divided into three subseries: Correspondence, Writing, and Research and Related Papers. Some correspondence and writing is found in the Research and Related Papers as well.
Substantial overlap exists in the subjects and persons found in the Personal and Professional series.

bioghist.p: Ralph W. Cummings (1911-2001) was born in Reidsville, North Carolina, on 13 December 1911. He was the son of William and Sarah Elizabeth Huffhines Cummings. He graduated from Reidsville High School in 1928 and went on to North Carolina State College of Agriculture and Engineering (later North Carolina State University) where he obtained a Bachelor of Science degree in 1933. He earned a Ph.D. in Soil Science from Ohio State University in 1938.

Cummings worked as an assistant and associate professor at Cornell University in Ithaca, New York, from 1937 until 1942. He joined the faculty at North Carolina State College of Agriculture and Engineering in 1942 as the head of the Agronomy Department, a position he held until 1947. He held positions at North Carolina State College as first Associate Director, then Director, of the North Carolina Agricultural Experimental Station from 1948 until 1954, the head of the North Carolina Agricultural Mission to Peru from 1955 to 1956, the Administrative Dean for Research from 1969 to 1971, and finally, as an Emeritus Professor of Soil Science from 1977 until 1991.

Cummings was professionally involved in agricultural research and development for a number of other academic and private organizations as well. From 1956 until 1957 he was the field director and principal representative of the Rockefeller Foundation in India. From 1963 to 1968, Cummings served as Associate Director for Agricultural Sciences for the Rockefeller Foundation in New York City. He was the Ford Foundation's Agricultural Program Adviser for Asia and the Pacific from 1971 to 1972. He served as the Director of the International Rice Research Institute (IRII) in Manila, Philippines, in 1972; the Director General of the International Crops Research Institute for the Semi Arid Tropics (ICRISAT) in Hyderabad, India, from 1972 until 1977; the Chairman of the Technical Advisory Committee (TAC) for the Consultative Group on International Agricultural Research (CGIAR) from 1977 until 1982, and acting Director General of the International Irrigation Management Institute headquartered in Sri Lanka from 1983 to 1984.

Cummings was the recipient of the Ohio State University Distinguished Service Award in 1970, the Presidential End Hunger Award in 1988, the North Carolina State University Alumni Association Award in 1991, the Soil Science Society of America Distinguished Service Award in 1993,and the North Carolina State Outstanding Alumni Award in 1997. He received Honorary Degrees from Jawaharlal Nehru Agricultural University (Jabalpur, Madhya Pradesh, India) in 1967, North Carolina State University in 1968, Punjab Agricultural University (Ludhiana, Punjab, India) in 1970, the Govind Ballabh Pant University of Agriculture and Technology (Udham Singh Nagar, Uttarakhand, India) in 1971, and Ohio State University in 1992. He was awarded the Watauga Medal by North Carolina State University in 1995. The Cereal Research Lab at the Indian Agricultural Research Institute was renamed Cummings Laboratory in his honor.

Cummings was a member of the American Society of Agronomy, American Academy of Arts and Sciences,and Rotary International. He served as the vice president of the Rotary Club of Raleigh, North Carolina, from 1952 to 1954 and the president from 1953 to 1954.

Cummings married Mary Parrish (1913-1989) of Reidsville, North Carolina, in 1936 and they had four children: Ralph Waldo, Walter B., William K., Mary Ann Hardee. Cummings married Eunice Perkinson in 1993. He died 25 June 2001.

prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Ralph W. Cummings Papers, MC 312, Special Collections Research Center, North Carolina State University Libraries, Raleigh, NC

scopecontent.p: The Ralph W. Cummings Papers document the personal and professional life of Ralph W. Cummings.

The primary focus of the collection is Cummings' career as a professor, researcher and administrator working in the fields of Soil science and agronomy during the course of which he was as a member and director of several international foundations and organizations concerned with agricultural research and the advancement of agricultural education around the globe such as the Ford Foundation, the Rockefeller Foundation and World Bank. Specific areas of research interest were aquaculture, tree crops, plant genetics and agroforestry. Cummings carried out his work in many different locations outside the United States, among them: India, Africa, Peru, the Philippines, Sri Lanka, and Indonesia.

Also included are Cummings family papers which include a number of land deeds and legal documents dating from 1840 until 2001, as well as the personal papers of Cummings' brother, Robert L. Cummings, and Robert Cummings' daughter, Gloria Cummings. These family papers also include correspondence with Gloria Cummings' associate, Francis De Graaff, a professor of Russian who taught at Reed College, Welles College, Black Mountain College, Harvard University, and Bryn Mawr College.
The Photograph series consists primarily of color slides taken during Ralph W. Cummings' professional international travels.

userestrict.p: The nature of the NCSU Libraries' Special Collections means that copyright or other information about restrictions may be difficult or even impossible to determine despite reasonable efforts. The NCSU Libraries claims only physical ownership of most Special Collections materials.

The materials from our collections are made available for use in research, teaching, and private study, pursuant to U.S. Copyright law. The user must assume full responsibility for any use of the materials, including but not limited to, infringement of copyright and publication rights of reproduced materials. Any materials used for academic research or otherwise should be fully credited with the source.

International Crops Research Institute for the Semi-arid Tropics
International Laboratory for Research on Animal Diseases
International Service for National Agricultural Research
Consultative Group On International Agriculture Research

scopecontent.p: This series contains the personal and legal documents and correspondence of Ralph W. Cummings as well as the extended Cummings family. A significant portion of the family papers were generated by Ralph W Cummings' brother Robert Cummings and his niece Gloria Cummings. Also included are legal papers and land deeds dating into the first half of the 19th century. Cummings' personal correspondence includes letters written to his family as well as friends and work associates. The documents include news clippings related to his work, travel and family. There are some letters in the documents subseries and there is also some overlap between the Personal Papers series and the Professional Papers.

scopecontent.p: The Photographs series consists primarily of color slides taken during Cummings' professional travels. There are images of conferences, crop research, and professional associates as well as landscape, travel portraits, still objects, personal and familial subjects. Also included are black and white prints of Cummings and associates in China.

Black and White photos from China

scopecontent.p: The Professional Papers series comprises the largest part of the collection, with the bulk of the material falling between 1976 and 1982. The Correspondence subseries contains letters concerning various research projects and administrative issues as well as planning for conferences and consortia. Correspondence is organized alphabetically in some cases and chronologically in others. Whenever possible the original order was maintained. Professional Writings contains academic papers, notes, and speeches written by Cummings over the course of his career. The items in the Research and Related Series contain notes, correspondence, writings by Cummings as well as other academic and professional researchers working in the fields of agronomy, soil science, and various other areas of agricultural education. This subseries also contains administrative papers associated with the numerous organizations with which Cummings was affiliated, including the Rockefeller Foundation, the Ford Foundation, the International Rice Research Institute (IRII), the International Crops Research Institute for the Semi Arid Tropics (ICRISAT), the International Irrigation Management Institute, Rotary International, and the Rotary Club of Raleigh, North Carolina.
